Company: Connecticut Office of Policy and Management
Description of incident: Police are investigating the theft of personal information — including Social Security numbers, names and addresses — from as many as 11,000 people who had applied for furnace rebate programs with the state. The investigation by Hartford and state police has led them to a woman who worked at the state Office of Policy and Management from May 2008 until May 2009. There have been no arrests. The state collected Social Security numbers because the refunds are federally taxable and the state was required to send a 1099 tax form to the recipients.
